intro: Schizostemma longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved schizostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves that are finely divided, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers, which are typically arranged in umbels. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, woodland habitats. Schizostemma longifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soils.
